definition:
An Euler circuit is a connected graph such that starting at a vertex
$a$, one can traverse along every edge of the graph once to each of the
other vertices and return to vertex $a$. In other words, an Euler
circuit is an Euler path that is a circuit. Thus, using the properties
of odd and even vertices given in the definition of an Euler path, an
Euler circuit exists if and only if every vertex of the graph has an
even degree.
